maml:description.maml:para: Adds a DoH server configuration to the supported DoH servers.
The Add-DnsClientDohServerAddress cmdlet adds a DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) server configuration to the supported DoH servers.
Specifies the IP address of the DoH server.
Specifies a valid URI template used to connect to the DoH server.
Specifies whether to allow fallback to unencrypted DNS if the DoH query to the server fails. This parameter applies only if AutoUpgrade is `True`. The default is `False`.

Specifies whether to encrypt all name resolutions to this server using the DoH settings. The upgrade occurs if the server is configured on an adapter or if it is part of a Name Resolution Policy Table (NRPT) rule. The default is `False`.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the `*-Job` cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113372)cmdlet.
For more information about Windows PowerShell background jobs, see about_Jobs (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113251).

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies whether to allow fallback to unencrypted DNS if the DoH query to the server fails. This parameter applies only if AutoUpgrade is `True`. The default is `False`.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the `*-Job` cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113372)cmdlet.
For more information about Windows PowerShell background jobs, see about_Jobs (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113251).

Specifies whether to encrypt all name resolutions to this server using the DoH settings. The upgrade occurs if the server is configured on an adapter or if it is part of a Name Resolution Policy Table (NRPT) rule. The default is `False`.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies a valid URI template used to connect to the DoH server.
Specifies the IP address of the DoH server.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds 10.23.1.1 to the system DoH list with the specified URI template.

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 2: Add a DoH server with automatic upgrade ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds 10.23.1.1 to the system DoH list with the specified URI template. The command upgrades any resolutions to 10.23.1.1 to DoH. If the encrypted name resolution fails, the command allows fallback to unencrypted DNS.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the DoH server configuration.
The Get-DnsClientDohServerAddress cmdlet gets the DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) server configuration for supported DoH servers. If you don't specify a server, the command displays all supported DoH servers.
Specifies the IP addresses for which to retrieve the system DoH configuration. Addresses must be present in the system list for the command to succeed.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the `*-Job` cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113372)cmdlet.
For more information about Windows PowerShell background jobs, see about_Jobs (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113251).

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Get configuration for all DoH servers -------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets configuration for all supported DoH servers.

command:example.maml:title: ---- Example 2: Get configuration for specific DoH servers ----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets DoH configuration for the servers 10.23.1.1 and 10.18.1.1.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes DoH server configurations from the supported DoH servers.
The Remove-DnsClientDohServerAddress cmdlet removes DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) server configurations from the supported DoH servers.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the `*-Job` cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113372)cmdlet.
For more information about Windows PowerShell background jobs, see about_Jobs (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113251).

The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the input to this cmdlet. You can use this parameter, or you can pipe the input to this cmdlet.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Remove configuration for DoH servers -------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example removes DoH configuration for the servers 10.23.1.1 and 10.18.1.1.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an existing DoH server configuration.
The Set-DnsClientDohServerAddress cmdlet modifies an existing DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) server configuration.
Specifies a valid URI template used to connect to the DoH server.
Specifies whether to allow fallback to unencrypted DNS if the DoH query to the server fails. This parameter applies only if AutoUpgrade is `True`. The default is `False`.

Specifies whether to encrypt all name resolutions to this server using the DoH settings. The upgrade occurs if the server is configured on an adapter or if it is part of a Name Resolution Policy Table (NRPT) rule. The default is `False`.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the `*-Job` cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113372)cmdlet.
For more information about Windows PowerShell background jobs, see about_Jobs (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113251).

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 1: Change the URI template for a DoH server -----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example changes the URI template for 10.23.1.1. The command sets the AutoUpgrade and AllowFallbackToUdp values to the default value `False`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Change the URI template for a DoH server with automatic upgrade

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example changes the URI template for 10.23.1.1. The command also upgrades any resolutions to 10.23.1.1. The AllowFallbackToUdp parameter value defaults to `False`. If the encrypted name resolution fails, it does not revert to unencrypted DNS.
